rsvp.data: I agree that my information will be stored for wedding planning purposes and deleted on 15 December 2025. The data will be securely stored in a protected internal database and will only be accessible to authorized persons. It will not be shared with third parties.

button.warning: Missing some info ‚Äì please fill in!

info.intro1: We are so lucky to have found our profound love for each other, and would love to keep writing our story with you on it. We're so thrilled to be celebrating this special chapter with the people we love the most. Thank you for being part of our journey ‚Äî your love and support mean everything to us. We can't wait to say 'I do' surrounded by our favorite people.
info.intro2: "Love is the closest thing we have to magic." - Anonymus
info.descr2: Cardedeu, Lago de Coatepeque, El Salvador
info.descr3: Come dressed like you‚Äôre crashing the Oscars‚Ä¶
info.descr4: We live in Switzerland, we're getting married in El Salvador, and unfortunately our suitcases are allergic to blenders. Your love and laughter are more than enough. But if you insist, help fuel our honeymoon adventure fund!
info.title5: Transportation needed on the day of the wedding?
info.descr5: We are happy to offer you a shuttle service on the day of the wedding. A bus will depart from San Salvador at 2:30 PM and bring you back at 1:30 AM. You can also reserve only one of the two rides. If you would like to use the shuttle, please indicate this in the RSVP form. Additionally, we will provide a nighttime shuttle service at the lake, running flexibly between the wedding location and the accommodations.
info.end: Kindly confirm your attendance before July 31, 2025.

history.descr1: It was the winter of 2018 in Hamburg, Germany‚Äîcold winds outside, but something warm was already beginning to stir. Michel and Dani were both working on Airbus projects when Dani, sitting quietly on a bus, caught sight of a sweet-faced stranger. ‚ÄúOh, that rubito is very cute,‚Äù she thought, smiling to herself. She had no idea that this simple moment would change everything. Just one week later, fate knocked‚Äîquite literally. On a regular workday, Dani heard someone at her office door. When she opened it, there he was: Michel. Her heart skipped a beat. She was so taken by surprise, so overwhelmed by a sudden wave of warmth, that she hugged him right then and there‚Äîcompletely forgetting that spontaneous hugs aren't exactly part of German office etiquette. A few days later, a Christmas market after-work event brought everyone together. The lights were glowing, laughter echoed around mulled wine, and something magical began to bloom. And just like that, a love story began.
history.descr2: This was the year of loving each other, laughter, travel, and countless adventures. They discovered new places and, more importantly, discovered each other in deeper ways with every step.
history.descr3: On September 12th, during a road trip through the breathtaking coastlines of Croatia, the universe gave them an unexpected gift. In the middle of nowhere, at a small roadside caf√©, a scruffy little dog stood alone. He looked at them with eyes full of hope. Without hesitation, they scooped him into their arms‚Äîand into their hearts. They named him Jamie. From that day on, their duo became a trio, and life felt even fuller.
history.descr4: When Michel found the job of his dreams‚Äîtucked away in the quiet town of Backnang‚Äîthere was no hesitation. No doubts. Dani looked at him with love and simply said, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go.‚Äù They packed up their lives and moved together, knowing that home wasn‚Äôt a place‚Äîit was being together.
history.descr5: By July 2023, their hearts were craving mountains, lakes, and a deeper connection with nature. That dream led them to Switzerland, where they felt at home the moment they arrived. A new chapter, filled with alpine air, peaceful mornings, and the sense that they were exactly where they were meant to be.
history.descr6: On December 31st, 2024, under the magic of the year‚Äôs final sunset, Michel and Dani said yes to forever. They got engaged, surrounded by love, memories, and dreams yet to be written. And now, they want to share that joy with you. Because every great love story deserves to be celebrated‚Äînot just by two people, but by the hearts who witnessed it grow.

guide.plan1: We will arrive in El Salvador on December 20 and use the first few days to finalize preparations for the wedding.
guide.plan2: On December 24 and 25, we will celebrate Christmas with our family. Guests from Europe and the US are warmly invited to join us during this special time.
guide.plan3: On December 26, we will go together to the lake (Lago de Coatepeque) and stay there until December 29. We plan to rent a large house for all international guests for these days.
guide.plan4: Additionally, we have our own house complex directly by the lake, where everyone is welcome to come during the day to eat and spend time together.
guide.plan5: It may also be possible to stay overnight on our property ‚Äì in a room or with a tent. If you are interested, please contact us directly.
guide.plan6: From December 29, we plan to go to the beach and rent a large beach house for everyone who wants to join.
guide.plan7: We will celebrate New Year's Eve together there and expect to stay at the beach until January 3.
guide.plan8: For everyone who wants to stay longer, we are happy to help with individual planning. We ourselves plan to return on January 6.
guide.plan9: Please let us know if you're interested in joining one or more parts of this journey. The sooner we know who is coming, the better we can plan and keep you updated with more details.
guide.plan10: Of course, you can also plan your own trip and just join for parts of the journey ‚Äì everything is optional!
guide.plan1: We are traveling to El Salvador on December 20 and will use the first few days to finalize preparations for the wedding.
guide.plan2: On December 24 and 25, we will celebrate Christmas together with our family. Guests from Europe and the US are warmly invited to join and spend this special time with us.
guide.plan3: On December 26th, we'll go to the lake (Lake Coatepeque) together and stay there until December 30th. We plan to rent a large house for all the international guests. We also have our own resort right on the lake, where everyone is welcome. We're suggesting a hangover barbecue on the 28th for the day, so we can soak up the effects of the alcohol together and have a relaxing day at the lake. On the 29th, we can climb the Santa Ana or Izalco volcanoes, which are located near the lake, and then return to the lake house to sleep.
guide.plan4: Starting December 30, we want to go to the beach and rent a large beach house for everyone who wants to join. We will celebrate New Year's Eve together there and plan to stay until January 3.
guide.plan5: For anyone who wants to stay longer, we‚Äôre happy to help with individual planning. We ourselves plan to return on January 6.
guide.plan6: Please let us know if you‚Äôre interested in joining one or more parts of this trip. The sooner we know who‚Äôs coming, the better we can organize and provide further details.
guide.plan7: Of course, you can also plan your own trip and join us for just some parts. Everything is possible, nothing is mandatory!
guide.intro: For a flexible and comfortable journey through El Salvador, we recommend booking a rental car. This way, you can start your trip right after landing without any detours.
guide.rentalDescr1: Saves time and makes arrival and departure easier.
guide.rentalDescr2: All key destinations are accessible without a 4x4. However, if you love adventure and want to go off the beaten path, it's a good choice.
guide.rentalDescr3: Make sure to have full coverage (e.g. fully comprehensive with no deductible) for maximum protection.
guide.rentalDescr4: Both platforms offer a good overview of prices, insurance options, and vehicle types ‚Äì often cheaper than booking directly.
guide.extro: Feel free to reach out to us anytime if you have any questions.
guide.mustSee1: Colonial town with art, culture, and views of Lake Suchitl√°n.
guide.mustSee2: Mountain villages with coffee, street food, and waterfalls.
guide.mustSee3: Hike to an active volcano with a turquoise crater lake.
guide.mustSee4: Surf spot with sunsets and black sand beach.
guide.mustSee5: UNESCO World Heritage Site: preserved pre-Columbian village.
guide.mustSee6: Largest Mayan ruin in El Salvador with an impressive pyramid.
guide.mustSee7: Hiking with views of three volcanoes in lush nature.
guide.mustSee8: Peaceful surf spot and part of the Bitcoin Beach initiative.
guide.mustSee9: Turquoise crater lake, perfect for swimming and relaxing.
guide.mustSee10: Capital city with museums, street art, and modern architecture.
guide.mustSee11: Viewpoint with spectacular rock formations and views over the land.
guide.mustSee12: Largest coastal bay in El Salvador with mangroves, dolphins, and kayaking.
